sep.gaia.renderer.layer

Class TileAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.gaia.renderer.layer.ResourceAdapter<R>
      • sep.gaia.renderer.layer.TileAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResourceObserver<TileResource>

    public class TileAdapter
extends ResourceAdapter<R>
    This class receives information about all currently available tiles and processes to fit the requirements of the TileLayer. Apart from converting coordinates the creation of textures from the tile-images is done here.
    Author:
    Johannes Bauer, Matthias Fisch

    • Method Detail

      • onUpdate

        public void onUpdate(java.util.Collection<TileResource> resources)
        Method called when new resources are available. It must be overridden and should make all elements in resources fitting the respective layer. Note that this method is called outside the OpenGL-thread and thus must not contain any OpenGL-specific calls. To schedule texture-creation call scheduleTextureCreation() and it will be created later in the GL-context.
        Important: For the caching to work correctly, all methods overriding must call this implementation via super.onUpdate(resources)
        Specified by:
        onUpdate in interface ResourceObserver<TileResource>
        Parameters:
        resources - The resources recently updated.

      • getTexture

        public com.jogamp.opengl.util.texture.Texture getTexture(java.lang.String key)
        Checks first if a texture with the given key is contained in primary texture-cache. If it is not the secondary texture-cache is checked. For a description of the caches see Caching.
        Parameters:
        key - The name of the texture.
        Returns:
        The texture identified by key or null if it is not found in both caches.
